Package org.codemonkey.swiftsocketclient

Provides the classes to create a TCP / UDP socket client that communicates using custom serialized Java messages objects.

See:
          Description

Interface Summary
ClientEndpoint Abstraction of the client socket.
ServerMessageToClient<Controller> Defines a base for decodable and executable message types.
 

Class Summary
ClientEndpointTCP Wrapper that delegates all calls directly to the decorated Socket.
ClientEndpointUDP Wrapper that adds TCP like server handling to the UDP DatagramSocket.
ClientMessageToServer Provides a default DatagramEncoder implementation that returns an empty string.
ClientMessageToServerByeBye Message that handles graceful disconnection attempts by the client.
ClientMessageToServerPingPong Message that is a Pong response to a Ping message.
ServerContext Contains all session data concerning the server.
ServerEndpoint Abstraction of the server socket.
ServerEndpointTCP Simply delegates all calls to the Socket.
ServerEndpointUDP Server endpoint that handles UDP traffic and maintains a list of known and new datagram messages.
ServerHandler Worker thread for the client server that is dedicated to the singular server.
ServerMessageToClientInvalid Wrapper class of which instances substitute bad client-to-server messages.
ServerMessageToClientPingPong Represents a server Ping message and when executed responds with a Pong message via ServerHandler.pong().
ServerUtil Helper class mainly to hide some boilerplate code concerning Thread.sleep(long).
SwiftSocketClient A low level message client that mediates messages from and to a server and the client in the form of 'datagrams' (custom serialized messages identified by a unique signature).
 

Enum Summary
ClientType Defines the type of client, ClientType.UDP or ClientType.TCP.
 

Exception Summary
UnknownMessageException Exception type thrown when a client-to-server message was not recognized by its identifier.
 

Package org.codemonkey.swiftsocketclient Description

Provides the classes to create a TCP / UDP socket client that communicates using custom serialized Java messages objects.

The Request Socket Client involves one requirement to function: user classes implementing ClientMessageToServer and ServerMessageToClient to register self-encoding/decoding Java message objects with the server.

Note that the client mode (TCP / UDP) doesn't change how the user interacts with the server: the type of transport is managed by the client without breaking API.

Since:
1.0
